unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explore different methods of data analysis and presentation for social networks, complex systems and relational links.
Evaluate conclusions drawn from different data and analytic tools.
Apply intermediate skills in spreadsheets and data visualisation software to demonstrate trends and relationships among factors in industry and society.
Create interactive models using appropriate software to aid decision-makers in understanding interrelationships and trends.
Analyse government, industry and social media data to identify relationships and trends.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparation for lectures, tutorials and assessment tasks.

enrolment_rules.description: (STAT150 or STAT1250 or STAT170 or STAT1170 or STAT171 or STAT1371) and (COMP115 or COMP1000 or ISYS114 or COMP1350)

assessments.description: Groups will create an interactive model using appropriate software tools to allow a user to better understand relationships within a chosen problem domain.
Students will create a model of complex interaction and test the sensitivity of outcomes to various inputs.
Students will use visualisation software to extract spreadsheet data to demonstrate interrelationships in different ways appropriate to the task.
Students will be asked to demonstrate skills in data manipulation.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

academic_org.value: Department of Actuarial Studies and Business Analytics

data.description: Growing quantities of data collected by business, government, the internet and social media provide opportunities for better management and a better society through evidence-based decision-making and the provision of new services. This unit introduces students to quantitative techniques and approaches to achieve these goals. Students will gain hands-on experience with software tools to analyse and present quantitative data. Students will be introduced to the discovery and analysis of social networks, social trends, and relationships amongst industry factors using spreadsheets and data visualisation software. The unit thus is an introduction to the technical and philosophical skills required, and the many applications of business analytics.
data.title: Fundamentals of Business Analytics
